titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the William Russell Philp collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-05-01T20:03-0700

did.unittitle: William Russell Philp collection
did.abstract: The William Russell Philp collection consists of intelligence reports, interrogation reports, maps, and photographs relating to Adolf Hitler, the German military structure, national socialism, various aspects of German society during and immediately after World War II, various military campaigns of World War II (particularly preparation for the invasion of Normandy), denazification, and post-war reconstruction in Germany.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Russell Philp collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1968.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

chronitem.event: Commissioned Second Lieutenant of Field Artillery, Regular Army
Served in France during World War I with the 17th Field Artillery, Second U.S. Infantry Division
Served in various commissioned grades at various stations, including three years in Hawaii
Assigned as Assistant Corps Artillery Officer, V Corps. Helped plan artillery support for D-Day landings on Omaha Beach, Normandy, and landed on Omaha Beach on D-Day with the V Corps.
Served with V Corps Headquarters through end of World War II.
Assigned to organize and command the European Command Intelligence Service Center at Oberursel, Germany. Completed two assignments for duty with the CIA and two with Army Intelligence.

bioghist.p: Colonel William Russell Philp was a career military officer, serving in the first and second world wars. Philp was largely responsible for recreating the counter-intelligence corps of the West German government after World War II. Awarded decorations include the U.S. Legion of Merit with Oak Leaf Cluster, Silver Star, Bronze Star, Purple Heart, Commendation Medal, French Legion of Honor, French Croix de Guerre with bronze star of World War I and Croix de Guerre with palm of World War II, Knights of Malta Cross of Merit, Knights of St. John Cross of Merit, and eight U.S. Campaign medals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The William Russell Philp collection includes a variety of materials, largely produced by the U.S. Army, that depict German society before, during, and immediately after World War II. Collection inlcudes interrogation reports produced by the Military Intelligence Service Center which document the July 1944 attempt on Hitler’s life. Additionally, there are reports on World War II military operations and post-war life in Germany, that cover such topics as denazification efforts, refugees, and prisoners of war. Related to the latter are two volumes of signatures and photographs of German individuals held in Allied custody for trial at Nuremberg.

The collection also contains a significant amount of material related to Philp’s involvement with planning the landings at Normandy, including aerial reconnaissance photos and an original annotated waterproof map of Normandy beaches showing the invasion strategy, as well as other maps and landing diagrams.

Also of note are albums depicting Hitler’s visit to Italy in May of 1938 and Joachim von Ribbentrop’s 1939 trip to Moscow that resulted in the signing of the Soviet-German non-aggression pact, as well as copies of Hitler’s marriage license and private and political testaments and photographs of Eva Braun and others at Hitler’s mountain retreat.
The original order, numbering, and naming of the items in the collection has been maintained.

did.unittitle: Item 1. Istituto Nazionale Luce, "Il viaggio del Führer in Italia,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Blue, leather-bound photograph album (oversize).

did.unittitle: Item 2. Presentation copy by the Governor of Rome, Piero Colonna, of an album of sketches of Rome

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Red, leather-bound album, with signature of Heinrich Himmler on flyleaf. The sketches show various monuments decorated with flags and banners in honor of Hitler's visit, as seen by an Italian artist.

did.unittitle: Item 3. Great Britain, Foreign Office, Germany: Basic Handbook,
Item 4. Two volumes of signatures (usually with attached photograph) of German personalities in Allied custody,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The two volumes are not totally identical. An identification of the prisoners' official positions is usually given. An additional folder of signatures (mostly military), Spring 1946, can be found in Box 13.

did.unittitle: Item 5a. Two photograph albums of Joachim von Ribbentrop's trip to Moscow,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The photographs were taken by Gisela Pönzgen-Döhm and are of high quality. Includes shots of the signing of the Soviet-German non-aggression pact, as well as shots of Stalin, Molotov, Russian military personnel, Count von der Schulenburg (German ambassador), and Gustaf Hilger. Two negatives depicting the 1939 signing of the Soviet-German non-aggression pact by von Ribbentrop, Stalin, and Molotov can be found in Box 1.

did.unittitle: Item 5b. One photograph album of Joachim von Ribbentrop's activities in Berlin during the visit of the Japanese ambassador, Nobufumi Ito,
Item 6. Commemorative volume, presentation document of decoration (oak leaves for the Knight's Cross) to Paul Gildner,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Parchment with gold calligraphy and metal eagle on cover.

did.unittitle: Item 7. Photostatic copies of Adolf Hitler's marriage license, private testament, and political testament, as well as of a handwritten cover note by Martin Borman (dated 29 April 1945) on transferring the documents to Admiral Doenitz in Flensburg,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes one set of mimeographed English translations.

did.unittitle: Item 8a. "Eye-witness Account of the 20th July 1944,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report summarizes in English the account by a prisoner of war (Karpinsky) who was captured by Allied Forces on 6 March 1945.

did.unittitle: Item 8b. "Account of the Twentieth of July Putsch by One of the Minor Conspirators,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report summarizes in English the account by a prisoner of war (Arntz) who was captured by Allied Forces on 19 March 1945.

did.unittitle: Item 8c. Berlin District Interrogation Center, Consolidated Interrogation Report, "The Political and Social Background of 20 July Incident,"
Item 8d. Motekat, "Concerning 20 July 1944,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Reported from memory and based on testimony and the summarizing address at the trial before the People's Court."

did.unittitle: Item 8e. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Consolidated Interrogation Report No. 6, "Political Background of 20 July 1944,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sources: Freiherr Rudolf von Gersdorff, Walter Hugo Gladisch, Helmuth Greiner, Dr. Karl M. Hettlage, Adolf Heusinger, Heinrich von Luettwitz, Ritter Wilhelm von Schramm, Freiherr Geyr von Schweppenburg, Graf Gerhard von Schwerin, Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk, and Heribert von Strempel.

did.unittitle: Item 9a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Report No. 36, "Adolf Hitler: A Composite Picture,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sources: Dr. Hugo J. Blaschke, Dr. Karl Brandt, Wilhelm F. Brueckner, Karl von Eberstein, Erwin Giesing, Dr. Hans Karl von Hasselbach, Heusinger, Dr. Julius Lippert, Hans-Joachim Riecke, Dr. Paul O. Schmidt, Gerhard von Schwerin, and Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk.

did.unittitle: Item 9b. "Professor Morrell,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript manuscript about Dr. Theo Morrell, written by a German in faulty English.

did.unittitle: Item 9c. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Consolidated Interrogation Report No. 2, "Hitler as Seen by His Doctors,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sources: Dr. Erwin Giesing, Dr. Hanskarl von Hasselbach, and Dr. Karl Brandt. Includes declassified records returned to file after December 2015.

did.unittitle: Item 9d. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Consolidated Interrogation Report No. 4, "Hitler as Seen by His Doctors,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sources: Dr. Theo Morrell, Dr. Erwin Giesing, Dr. Walter Loehlein, Dr. Karl Weber, Dr. A. Nissle, and Dr. E. Brinkmann. Primarily based on an interview with Dr. Theo Morrell. Annexes include medical reports and X-ray pictures of Hitler's head taken in September 1944 (in separate folio) when he was treated for ear trouble, a possible result of the explosion of 20 July 1944. Includes declassified records returned to file after December 2015.

did.unittitle: Item 9e. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Final Interrogation Report No. 31, "Hitler's Teeth,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Dr. Hugo Johannes Blaschke. Includes declassified records returned to file after December 2015.

did.unittitle: Item 10. Eva Braun snapshots,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Six photographs of Eva Braun, Adolf Hitler, and others at Hitler's mountain retreat. Additionally, there are enlargements of two of the photographs.

did.unittitle: Item 11. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, The German General Staff Series,
The History of the German General Staff from 1806 to 1934 by Walter Warlimont, Gen. d.Art
The German General Staff Since World War I by Graf Gerhard von Schwerin, Gen. d.Pztr
The Character of the German General Staff from 1923 to 1945 by Karl Allmendinger, Gen. d.Inf
The Political Attitude of the German General Staff since 1920 by Walter Warlimont, Gen. d.Art
National Socialism and the German General Staff by Wilhelm Ritter von Schramm, Major d.R
The Political Attitude and Military Aptitude of the Younger Generation of General Staff Officers by Friedrich Berendsen, Oberst d.Kav,
The Attitude of the General Staff Toward Technology by Adolf Heusinger, Gen. Lt.d.Inf
The German General Staff and Technical Developments by Wilhelm Petersen, Gen. Maj. d.Pi
The Decline in Unity and Influence of the German General Staff by Bogislaw von Bonin, Oberst d.Pztr
Item 12. Cigaretten Bilderdienst, Deutschland erwacht: Werden, Kampf und Sieg der NSDAP,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Text by Wilfred Bade, photographs by Heinrich Hoffmann.

did.unittitle: Item 13. Heeresgruppe Nord, "Der Feldzug gegen die Sowjet-Union der Heeresgruppe Nord, Kriegsjahr 1943"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commemorative volume issued by the Oberkommando of the Wehrmacht containing detailed maps for the Russian campaign of Heeresgruppe (Army Group) Nord (copy 54).

did.unittitle: Item 14a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Intermediate Interrogation Report No. 12, "Austria,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Franz von Papen.

scopecontent.p: Source: Franz von Papen.

scopecontent.p: Source: Walter Warlimont.

scopecontent.p: Source: Adolf Heusinger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Karl Haushofer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Albert Hartl.

did.unittitle: Item 15f. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Intermediate Interrogation Report No. 29, "Critical Study of Experiences Gained in German Armored Operations,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Fritz Bayerlein.

did.unittitle: Item 15g. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Scavenger Special Report No. 20, "Panzer Lehr Division,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Fritz Bayerlein.

did.unittitle: Item 16. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, U Report No. 2, "Errors of the German Policy in the Ukraine (1941-1944),"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sources: "Prominent German and Ukrainian personalities in the German occupation of the Ukraine" and "[n]umerous documents of the East Ministry (Ostministerium-Rosenberg), of military and civilian administrative offices, and of key Ukrainians."

did.unittitle: Item 17a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, U Project Report No. 1, "German Experiences in the Seizure of Agricultural Products and the Struggle Against the Black Market in the Ukraine in the Years 1941-1944,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: "German documents and records, reports of undercover agents and of former German agricultural and economic experts." Includes declassified records returned to file after December 2015.

did.unittitle: Item 17b. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Intermediate Interrogation Report No. 36, "Agricultural Technology and the RKTL,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Hans Joachim Ernst Riecke.

did.unittitle: Item 17c. American report on German agriculture,
Item 18. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Final Interrogation Report No. 137, report on Communist agent Günter Heinz Manfred Tuttas,
Item 19. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Report No. 29, "The Mental Attitude of German Prisoners of War,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Hans-Gottfried von Watzdorf.

did.unittitle: Item 20. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Report No. 32, "Operations and Experiences of Frontaufklärung (FA) III Ost During the Eastern Campaign,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: former chief of the German Abwehr Leitstelle III Ost (formerly Walli III) and one of his former assistants.

did.unittitle: Item 21. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Reinterrogation Report No. 2, "Origin and Growth of National Socialism and National Socialism and the German People,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: member of the German Abwehr's Leitsetelle III Ost.

did.unittitle: Item 23a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Interrogation Report No. 26, Annex II, "GZI,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glowny Zarzad Informacji Wojska Polskiego (Central Office of the Information Services of the Polish Army). Also known as the Informacji. Source: Sergius Naumovich Perling. Photocopy.

did.unittitle: Item 23b. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Interrogation Report No. 26, Annex III, "The Serov Group,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy.

did.unittitle: Item 24. Detailed Interrogation Report, "A Study of the Rise of Naziism,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Graf Gerhard von Schwerin.

did.unittitle: Item 25. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Special Report No. 28, interrogation of Dimitri Tivin, NKVD agent,
Item 26. Headquarters, 12th Army Group, Interrogation Center, Intermediate Interrogation Report, interrogation of Ernst Kaltenbrunner, chief of the RHSA,
Item 27. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Reinterrogation Report No. 7, "Goering's Views on Certain Aspects of German Foreign Policy,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Source: Hermann Goering.

did.unittitle: Item 28. CLOSED

Item 29a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Preliminary Interrogation Report No. 35, interrogation of Heribert Hugo von Strempel, Secretary in the Foreign Office,

Item 29b. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, Intermediate Interrogation Report No. 37, interrogation of Kurt Henschel, employee of the German Foreign Service,
Item 30. "Report on the Further Development in the Eastern Zone,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report by Christian Geiger-Helbe with cover letters and documentary annexes on conditions in the Soviet zone of occupation. Includes declassified records returned to file after December 2015.

did.unittitle: Item 31. Office of the United States High Commissioner for Germany, Office of the Land Commissioner for Hesse, Intelligence Division, "Periodic Intelligence Report for the Week Ending 2400 Hours, January 2, 1950 (Summary No. 178),"
Item 32. Report on border traffic between the border refugee Camp Hof-Moschendorf (U.S. Zone) and the Soviet Zone, with report on morale,
Item 33a. "Resolve of the Politburo of the WKPB [All-Russian Committee of the Party of Bolsheviks],"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript drafts with handwritten annotations from Mr. Silver to Col. Philp dated 10 November 1934, 14 November 1934, 23 November 1934, 26 November 1934, 7 January 1935, and 5 February 1935.

did.unittitle: Item 33b. "Some Remarks on 'Sources of Soviet Conduct' by Mr. X," E. Mylkevich,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cover letter by Mylkevich to Col. Philp, dated 18 September 1947 [though this would seem to be incorrect, given that the letter mentions an editorial of 10 October 1947].

did.unittitle: Item 33c. "Political Notes on the USSR and US" [E. Mylkevich],
Item 33d. "Comments on Mr. John Fischer's Articles on Soviet Life [New York Herald Tribune], Nov. 6-10, 1946," E. Mylkevitch,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes original articles.

did.unittitle: Item 33d. Letter from E. Mylkevich to Walter Lippmann re Soviet Union,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lippmann was the political correspondent for the New York Herald Tribune.

did.unittitle: Item 34. Documents from Raymond Jadin, Prosecuting Justice, Military Tribunal of Strasbourg,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cover letter dated 21 December 1947 indicating enclosures of two examinations of ex-Gauleiter [Robert] Wagner (5 February and 11 March 1946), the examination of Magistrate [Friedrich Karl] Simon (28 January 1946), the examination of Marshall [Wilhelm] Keitel (12 April 1946), and letters of congratulations to Jadin from his military chiefs (dated 14 May 15 November 1946).

did.unittitle: Item 35a. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, "United State, Federal State, Confederacy," Lutz Schwerin von Korsigk, Minister of Finance,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cover memorandum dated 31 January 1947, "Report on German Political History," indicating that the report was originaly written in German.

did.unittitle: Item 35b. "Proposals for Denazification,"
Item 35c. Extract from "Disease of Persecution," Dr. W. Stapel,
Item 35d. "Characteristics of the German Officials,"
Item 35e. "The Difficulties of the Church in Germany,"
Item 35f. "Law Suits Against War-Criminals,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also includes a typescript about an encounter with a Russian woman on a train.

did.unittitle: Item 35g. "Reparations,"
Item 36a. Collection Section, United States Forces in the European Theater, 7707 European Command Intelligence Center, "Interrogation of Illegal Border Crossers,"
Item 36b. "Exploitation of PW Returnees and Illegal Border Crossers, Progress Report for June 1952,"
Item 36c. United States Forces in the European Theater, 7707 European Command Intelligence Center, "Effectiveness and Value of an IBC Exploitation Program,"

Item 36d. "Report on Conditions Found in Straubing and Nuremberg (Camp Valka) as They Affect the Scientific and Technical Intelligence Collection Effort by Mr. J. L. Boughal, Mr. J. A. Fuhrken, and Mr. J. C. Pallenberg,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: There is a handwritten date on the front of 4 February 1952.

did.unittitle: Item 36e. "Conditions Affecting the Exploitation of German IBCs for Scientific and Technical Intelligence,"
Item 37. Office of Military Government for Germany (U.S.), Office of the Military Governor, "Law for Liberation from National Socialism and Militarism,"

Item 38. Allied Control Authority, Coordinating Committee, Directive No. 38, "Arrest and Punishment of War Criminals, Nazis and Militarists and the Internment, Control, and Surveillance of Politically Dangerous Germans,"
Item 39. Office of Military Government for Germany (U.S.), Information Services Division, Opinion Surveys Branch, Report No. 160, "Germans Consider the Withdrawal of the Occupying Powers,"
Item 40. Annex No. 1 to Corps Artillery Intelligence Report No. 156, "Special Report: The Odyssey of Goetz von Berlichingen,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report from memory of a staff officer of the 17th SS Pz. Gren. Division.

did.unittitle: Item 41. "Die Familien Katastrophe der Internierten: Eine 1000 Mann Umfrage,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Related to Camp 74 at Ludwigsburg. Includes English translation ("Internees' Family Troubles: An Enquiry Amongst 1000 Internees").

did.unittitle: Item 42. Fragment of a report on German youth,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes sections on: school youth, working youth and returned soldiers, and young women; education (schools and their difficulties, denazification, teachers today and tomorrow); factors affecting youth (the home, the church, political parties, youth organizations); the occupation ("Demokratie," the American soldier, press and radio); and an epilogue.

did.unittitle: Item 43a. "Von Versailles bis Moskau," Baron Kurt von Lersner, former president of the German peace delegation,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("From Versailles to Moscow").

did.unittitle: Item 43b. "Territorial questions," Baron Kurt von Lersner,
Item 44a. "Mein politischer Werdegang" [Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("My Political Career").

did.unittitle: Item 44b. "Vereinigte Staaten von Mitteleuropa" [Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("The United States of Central Europe").

did.unittitle: Item 45a. "Internment Camps,"
Item 45b. "The Munich Agreement,"
Item 45c. "The Tragedy of Democracy in Germany" [Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk],
Item 45d. "Expelled to Death: Poland and the Potsdam Agreement" [Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk],
Item 45e. "Einige Beobachtungen über gewisse Methoden in der Behandlung der Bevölkerung im russisch besetzten Gebiet,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("Notes on Current Methods of Treatment of the Inhabitants of the Russian Zone of Occupation").

did.unittitle: Item 45f. English translation of a report by a German national on treatment by the CIC [American Counter Intelligence],
Item 45g. "Nuernberg,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of treatment of witnesses and accused at Nuremberg.

did.unittitle: Item 45h. "The Sentence of Nuernberg,"
Item 45j. Unsigned account by a prisoner of his interrogations at Nuermberg,
Item 46a. "Contributions to an Economic Plan for Germany,"
Item 46b. "Taxes and Monetary Reform,"
Item 46c. "Why Does Democracy Make No Progress in Germany?,"
Item 46d. "The Munich Agreement" [Graf Lutz Schwerin von Krosigk],
Item 46e. "Die Zerstörung der Familie,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("Desintegration [sic] of Families").

did.unittitle: Item 46f. "The United States of Europe,"
Item 47a. Problems with the denazification procedure, Eugen Kogon,
Item 47b. "Operations of the 3rd Mtz Div[ision] (from October 1944 to 13 April 1945)," Werner Paul Abramovsky, former Major,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript translated from Russian, then from German.

did.unittitle: Item 47c. "Combat Operations Against the US Army (from 2 January to 9 May 1945)," Otmar Richard Elwanger, former Hauptmann,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript translated from Russian, then from German.

did.unittitle: Item 47d. "Operations Against American Army Troops (from 5 June to Approximately 30 June 1944)," E. Mauer, former Lieutenant Colonel,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript translated from Russian, then from German (5 September 1946).

did.unittitle: Item 47e. "Defensive Battles Against the Americans and British [from 6 September to 1 November 1944]," Joseph Alois Rauch, former Generalmajor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript translated from Russian, then from German.

did.unittitle: Item 47f. "Operations Against American Troops in France," Schmidt, former Generalmajor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript translated from German and/or Russian.

did.unittitle: Item 48a. Correspondence re the Spanish Blue Division,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter from Dr. R. Schneider to Col. Philp, 2 March 1951; a letter in German, along with an English translation, from Merker to Col. Philp, 9 March 1951; and a letter from Merker to Col. Philp, 20 July 1951. The Spanish Blue Division fought with the Germans in a Russian campaign in 1943.

did.unittitle: Item 48b. "Bericht," Agnes von Heyden Gräfin von Cartlow,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation ("Report"). Details her personal experience with the war, particularly after the arrival of Russian troops in 1945.

did.unittitle: Item 48c. English translation of a report on Austria's political parties, their background, and their development, Otto A. A. Baron von Bolschwing,
Item 48d. "Gedanken zur derzeitigen Denazifizierungspolitik," Hans Jacobs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cover letter of 26 November 1946, as well as an English translation of the cover letter and report ("Notes on the Present Denazification Policy").

did.unittitle: Item 49. Intelligence report on Dr. Josef Müller, State Minister of Justice and Deputy Minister President of Bavaria,
Item 50a. "The Alpine Passes" [Adolph Heusinger],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General Project No. J-214. Study (with annexes) written at the request of Col. Philp.

did.unittitle: Item 50b. "Comments on the Study 'The German Army High Command (OKH) Within the Framework of the High Command of the Armed Forces,'" Heinz Guderian,
Item 51. Headquarters, United States Forces in the European Theater, Military Intelligence Service Center, "Economics: A German View,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes introduction and description of methods ("The German View: Second Investigation"), as well as a short report, "Some Germans Talk," with observations and opinions from Graf Schwerin (General der Panzer Truppen), J. Riecke (Undersecretary for Agriculture under Hitler), Dr. Karl Hettlage (financial expert of the Speer Ministry), and Dr. Helmut Fischer (Reference III C-1 of the Sicherheits Dienst).

did.unittitle: Item 52. "Allgemeine Lagebetrachtung,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an English translation ("General Survey of the Situation") and three extensive annexes.

did.unittitle: Item 53. CLOSED
